conclusion: Consider forces acting on sliders A and B; net force parallel to incline must be zero.
Forces on slider A: gravitational component, normal force, frictional force, tension.
Forces on slider B: gravitational component, normal force, frictional force, tension, external force F.
Set up equation for slider A: T - mg sin θ - μ mg cos θ = 0.
Set up equation for slider B: F - T - mg sin θ - μ mg cos θ = 0.
Solve for T: T = mg sin θ + μ mg cos θ.
Substitute T into slider B's equation: F = 2mg sin θ + 2μ mg cos θ.
Magnitude of external force F is 2mg.
